messages.subject: Re: [nihontostudy] Ginger versus hollyhock
messages.msgSnippet: Thank you. ... From: Richard Turner To: nihontostudy@yahoogroups.com Sent: Wednesday, July 02, 2003 10:28 PM Subject: Re: [nihontostudy] Ginger versus
messages.messageBody:
Thank you.
----- Original Message -----
From: Richard Turner
To: nihontostudy@yahoogroups.com
Sent: Wednesday, July 02, 2003 10:28 PM
Subject: Re: [nihontostudy] Ginger versus hollyhock


Hi David, I haveat home, a link to a great study group that deal only in Japanese plants and gardens. I have posted a few plant pics there before, for myself and friends and have got quick repsonces. When I get home I will forward a link to the list.

Rich
----- Original Message -----
From: David Zincavage
To: nihontostudy@yahoogroups.com
Sent: Thursday, July 03, 2003 1:22 PM
Subject: Re: [nihontostudy] Ginger versus hollyhock


Any insight on how one might differentiate ginger and hollyhock in sukashi tsuba motifs?

Anybody know of any good books discussing the symbolism of various plants, animals, and other devices in Japan?

Hi David, I haveat home, a link to a great study group that deal only in Japanese plants and gardens. I have posted a few plant pics there before, for myself and friends and have got quick repsonces. When I get home I will forward a link to the list.

Rich
